headshotImage.longCaption: JC Buttler headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Rishabh Pant c Buttler b Curran 78 (62b 5x4 4x6 79m) SR: 125.8

dismissalComment.html: edged and Buttler sticks out his left hand and pulls off a super-sharp one-handed catch. He makes it look ridiculously easy. Seam-up, pretty full and outside off, Pant camps back and aims to whip it away to the leg side. The ball hits the back of the bat and here comes Buttler's athletic intervention

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c & b Rashid 67 (56b 10x4 0x6 80m) SR: 119.64

dismissalComment.html: chipped tamely back to the bowler! A tumbling take in Rashid's followthrough, just catching the leading edge as Dhawan's face closes on a clip to the leg side, failed to pick the googly perhaps... that's a massive double-strike for England!

headshotImage.caption: MA Wood headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: MA Wood headshot

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: End of a charming cameo from Thakur. Wood hits that hard length once again outside off, gets it closer to off this time. Wood cranks it up to 144ks. Thakur has another mow to the leg side and ends up nicking it behind. Buttler judges it well and takes it to his right

headshotImage.caption: Krunal Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Krunal Pandya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Roy runs back from point, tumbles, and snaffles this. Back of a length and outside off. Pandya swings, ends up slicing it high, and holing out for a boundary-less 25 off 34 balls

headshotImage.caption: Prasidh Krishna player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Prasidh Krishna player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Wood nails the stumps. Krishna backs away outside leg and has a feeble prod at it. Wood fires it full and pings middle stump

headshotImage.longCaption: RG Sharma headshot

dismissalComment.html: Rashid provides England the breakthrough with the wrong'un. On a length and zipping in to strike the top of off. Rohit didn't pick the variation at all, playing for the legbreak. The spinner cuts the opening stand at 103. Rashid will now have Kohli to work with

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli b Ali 7 (10b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: a horrible hack from Kohli and he's bowled! Oh wow, that's turned a fair bit from an off-stump line, but Kohli's eyes were bigger than his stomach there, he rocked back for something wildly optimistic over the off-side, and had his leg stump clipped as the ball surged through... well, not so much a gate as a vacated citadel! England, from an invidious situation, are right back on it!

dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul c Ali b Livingstone 7 (18b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 38.88

dismissalComment.html: a second-ball wicket for Livingstone! It's a terrible ball, but it's bagged a massive scalp! A hip-high full toss, drawing a one-handed thump across the line, and Moeen behind square pulls off a blinder, pouncing to his left to cling on in both hands!

dismissalText.commentary: Hardik Pandya b Stokes 64 (44b 5x4 4x6 63m) SR: 145.45

dismissalComment.html: Pandya shuffles across off, exposes his stumps, Stokes hits the leg stump. England have dismissed Pant and Hardik in a space of four overs. Pandya pre-meditates, probably aiming for a glance, but Stokes bests him in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar c Curran b Topley 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Topley hits that in-between length outside off. Bhuvneshwar clears his front leg and aims to slug it down the ground. He can only carve it in the air. Curran swoops in from mid-off and pouches it to wrap up India's innings

dismissalComment.html: Thakur wheels away after getting the other set batsman: Malan. Hip-high short ball outside off, Malan jumps back and swats it straight into the lap of Rohit at short midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shardul Thakur player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: JC Buttler headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: JC Buttler headshot

dismissalComment.html: inducker from Thakur, slams the pad, not given out lbw. Kohli has a chat with Pant and asks for a review. Fullish and jagging back in to beat the inside edge and hit the front pad just above the knee-roll. Was this heading past leg stump? Nope, ball-tracking suggests that it would have struck leg stump. Golden arm: Shardul Thakur. Umpire Chaudhary has to reverse his on-field not-out decision

headshotImage.caption: Liam Livingstone player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Liam Livingstone player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Another England batsman is dismissed off a full-toss, Thakur gets lucky this time. Livingstone winds up to drill it away past Thakur. Instead, he can only toe-end it weakly back to the bowler

headshotImage.caption: Dawid Malan player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dawid Malan player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Thakur wheels away after getting the other set batsman: Malan. Hip-high short ball outside off, Malan jumps back and swats it straight into the lap of Rohit at short midwicket

headshotImage.caption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Adil Rashid player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: stunner from Kohli in the covers! A chipped drive, low to the skipper's left, he was only going to get there with one hand, and he plunges superbly to grab, and out pop his eyes on stalks. A one-man meme machine in this contest! Thakur's cutters make the priceless breakthrough!

headshotImage.caption: B Kumar headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: B Kumar headshot

headshotImage.caption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jason Roy player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: zings through the gate! Like I was intimating... in spite of the runs, Roy never quite looked at his imposing best in that extraordinary over, and he's undone with an utter pearler! Perfect length, perfect shape, nipping off the pitch, into the timbers through a flat-footed response!

headshotImage.caption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jonny Bairstow player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: way across his stumps and Bairstow is gone! He has reviewed, but that looked pretty adjacent to the naked eye. It may only be height that can save him. Leg stump is visible on the replay as his bat misses with a clip. Yep, thumping the top of leg, and both England's openers are gone!

headshotImage.caption: MM Ali headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: MM Ali headshot

dismissalComment.html: lobbed to mid-off! A hard-handed drive from Moeen, but that thumps the toe of the bat, can't get the power through the stroke, and Hardik atones by leaping forward to scoop the low chance!

dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes c Dhawan b Natarajan 35 (39b 4x4 1x6 53m) SR: 89.74

dismissalComment.html: full bunger on the pads, and Stokes has launched that straight to square leg! Huge moment ... is this above waist height? Stokes advanced to meet the ball, and that may undo him on the balance of probabilities. The ball was dipping, and yep, he has to go! That's a vast moment in this game. Advantage all India now

commentPreTextItems.html: No extras here, and it's over...

commentTextItems.html: pumped to long-on, but it's India's game and series!

commentPostTextItems.html: 10.53pm That was one heck of a finish. Fitting end to an absorbing white-ball series. Hope you enjoyed our coverage as much as we did bringing it to you. We have asmorgasbord of post-match content lined up for you. Make sure yousend in your #PoliteEnquiries for Miller and Varun. Don't forget the hashtag. Until next time, this is Deivarayan Muthu signing off for Andrew Miller, Saurabh Somani, Venkat Raghav and Chandan Duorah. Stay safe and cheers.

Virat Kohli, India captain: As I mentioned, when top-two teams battle, you get exciting games. England will not throw in the towel at any stage, Sam played well, but we kept taking wickets to put enough pressure on them. The mindset shifted in the last couple of overs. Hardik and Nattu were brilliant to finish it off. [It's] most disappointing for the guy to drop the catch. Everyone wants to do the best for the team on the field, but catches do get put down. But as individuals there's no lack of intent and we eventually ended up crossing the line. I mean I'm surprised that Thakur wasn't the Man of the Match. Four wickets and scoring 30 runs and Bhuvi was a big contender for Man of the Series. These guys were the difference in middle overs and powerplay. Prasidh and Krunal were impressive, but the most pleasing thing is the depth of our batting. Very exciting times ahead for us. It has been an amazing season for us and we wanted to finish on a high. This tour has been sweet, winning every series. Enjoy the IPL and back again with this group of guys. It is [a bit of a respite] for the support staff. Scheduling is something that needs to be looked at in these times...am sure things will be discussed and things will change in the future.

Jonny Bairstow, Man of the Series: Yeah, pretty pleased, but would have liked to be on the winning side of it at the end of the day. But, today, it wasn't meant to be. To come back from Tests and do this will give me a lot of confidence. To be honest, going outside off is a better way to counteract that [inswing]. Now, I'll be facing him at the [SRH] nets, don't have to worry about that. It was special from him [Curran] to take the game deep and his hitting was special. Obviously, credit to Nattu for nailing his yorkers. Obviously, everyone knows what Nattu does at the death. Fair play to him.

Sam Curran, Man of the Match: We didn't win the game, but happy with the way I played. I haven't done something like that for a while especially for England. Disappointed with the finish. I had a few messages from the dug-out as well: try to bat deep and try to take most of the strike. Fair play to Natarajan - he had six deliveries there and showed why he's a good bowler. I knew that one side is shorter and Bhuvi is an outstanding bowler. As I said, a massive learning curve for me, but disappointed at the end. Again, it's a learning series with the ball and feel like it has given me a lot of confidence for the IPL and next IPL. Going straight there [CSK] for the IPL.

Jos Buttler,England (stand-in) captain: Yeah, fantasticgame. Both times made mistakes and played some brilliant cricket. Unbelievable innings from Sam Curran...congratulations to India. We're disappointed, we came here and we wanted to win, but there have been great learnings throughout the process. The white-ball leg has been fantastic and close and today was no different. I think playing cricket in India is always a learning (experience) - the guys who made their debuts in this series. Guys willgo away as better cricketers. It was a fantastic wicket and we didn't bowl as well at the top but we dragged it back fantastically in the end. We pegged Hardik and Pant back to that total. A few guys [are] missing out, but the talent pool in white-ball cricket is growing and we'll continue to strive to do that. It was an amazing effort from Curran to take a lot of ownership and take most of the strike. I know Sam will be disappointed but he showed a lot of character and we are all proud of him.
It's also that time of the day or rather night. Do send in your #PoliteEnquiries for Miller and Varun. Don't forget the hashtag

Bhuvneshwar: It was tense, being a bowler you are always under pressure. There was dew and some tension in the ground. I wasn't worried about early boundaries. Inswing was the plan for me and that worked. Definitely, looking forward to the IPL. I'm just happy I went through this entire series.

Dhawan: I was always in the groove. Just that I wasn't playing (laughs). Once I got the chance I made the most of it. I was playing domestic cricket - Syed Mushtaq Ali and Vijay Hazare - and that was match practice for me. I'm glad I played those tournaments. The wicket was very good, especially the last two matches and I enjoy playing on such bouncy tracks.

10.17pm Wow! What a finish to this series, to this tour! India complete a clean sweep, but that's not the full story. Sam Curran's ODI best - by a distance - takes Englans so close to their first ODI series win in India since 1984. And my fingers are toast...

The unsung hero of that India win was Bhuvneshwar Kumar, whose figures stand out a mile in the wickets and runs column. Two big early breakthroughs put his side in command, and Thakur's cutters were vital in building on that advantage. But it was the rookie Natarajan who had to hold his nerve at the death. His yorkers are quite the thing. Right, I need a lie-down, here's Deiva to take us through the post-match.

Akhilesha: "England have such unbelievably good all rounders who put in their best performances in such crucial times!" --- Sam Curran, like Stokes, makes things happen...doesn't he? He just fell short today, Sam's 95* is the joint-highest score by a No.8 batsman in ODI cricket.. Woakes features a couple of times in this list
Ben Bradshaw: "A big shout out to Sam Curran, he brought England so close! A fitting end to the Indian tour for England.."<hr>

Sent back

commentTextItems.html: flogged to long-off, he missed his yorker, but Curran missed his wind-up! It's do or die now...

commentPostTextItems.html: Vaibhav: "This is the preview of WC final we didn't get in 2019. Equally exciting to one we had though"... yeah, that was decent entertainment in the circumstances!

commentTextItems.html: not this time, another full ball, wide line, and Curran drags to the leg side
good connection, pinged to deep point! That'll do...

commentPostTextItems.html: Curran is back on strike. Can he nail two big hits from four attempts?

commentTextItems.html: decent yorker, decent connection, drilled to long-on, Wood gets his World Cup final skates on in an attempt to run back to the danger end, but it's a brilliant bullet throw from Pandya to the keeper, and he's short!

commentPostTextItems.html: Redemption from Pandya for the clangers? What on earth can Topley do, a rabbit to end all rabbits

commentTextItems.html: opens the face on the full length, poked to point. Curran keeps the strike

commentPostTextItems.html: So, can Natarajan get that drop out of his mind, and nail his yorkers? What japes!

commentTextItems.html: right back on the stumps, Curran looks for a flick, but that's too full and straight to work with

commentPostTextItems.html: 15 off seven.... Curran needs a boundary, or a single
Abraham Finny: "In a parallel universe, the game would have been over by that ball" Or any of the previous drops

commentTextItems.html: high, hoisted over the leg side off the top edge, three men converge, Natarajan spills it! What is going orf out there! Slower ball, miles in the air to third man... he made a dive, but made a hash of it!

Wood has a wipe, and Thakur at midwicket has dropped another shocker! That is simply terrible, the match on the line, he barely got a finger to it as it plopped out of the lights on the edge of the circle... wow

commentPostTextItems.html: Curran's on strike too!

commentPreTextItems.html: Four men back on the leg side, just one cover sweeper

commentTextItems.html: on the back foot, open face, and a misfield! They've got to run for everything now, and Prasidh's lanky frame at third man can't stoop low enough

commentPostTextItems.html: The leg side is open for Wood...

commentTextItems.html: Curran gives himself room to leg, Hardik follows him. Good bowling, precious dot

commentPostTextItems.html: Zainulabeddin: "Hello Miller... How do you keep yourself energised in these kinda stressful match????" The stress does all the energising necessary!

commentTextItems.html: plays miles inside the line to see off the main threat Outside off, bouncing through to the keeper. Now then. Curran back on strike. 19 from 12 is the equation!

commentPostTextItems.html: Is Natarajan back with his yorkers... nope, it's Hardik... interesting call! This is excruciatingly tight! Who says 50 overs is the lesser format these days?

commentTextItems.html: very full, huge appeal, Bhuvi has the breakthrough! England review There did seem to be two sounds with Wood well back on his stumps for the inswinger.. nope, no bat, but it's going to be a dead ball if this is going over... missing!

commentPostTextItems.html: Crumbs, wipe me down! So, Wood is back on strike for the dead ball, no single there...

commentTextItems.html: bashed with a round-house slog down the ground! Pandya at long-on parries well to save the boundary. Wood's back on strike, but he wanted the second! Confusion!
slower ball, good ball. Curran blocks under his eyeline

commentPostTextItems.html: Badhat: "Can I sue the England team do you think for the stress, emotional, physical, they are putting me under? If this was the workplace I'd be signed off by my GP!" Seems entirely reasonable!

commentTextItems.html: another wide, down the leg side. Pant does brilliantly to limit the damage with a dive to his right
outside off, swinging away, Curran shapes to cut, leaves alone... and gets the wide

commentPostTextItems.html: Naresh: "Did Hardik dropped the trophy? " He's entitled to start wondering!

commentTextItems.html: fired past the leg stump, but flicks the pad along the way. No wide

commentPostTextItems.html: Akum: "Curran loves playing against India!!! Get that win!!"

commentPreTextItems.html: Sachin: "those 8 balls which India did not play as last three got out quickly is paying costly" hmmm!

commentTextItems.html: perfect from Wood... back of a length, flogged to deep cover. A precious single to get Curran back on strike

dismissalComment.html: a horrible hack from Kohli and he's bowled! England, from an invidious situation, are right back on it!

dismissalText.commentary: Rohit Sharma b Rashid 37 (37b 6x4 0x6 71m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Rashid provides England the breakthrough with the wrong'un. On a length and zipping in to strike the top of off. Rohit didn't pick the variation at all, playing for the legbreak. The spinner cuts the opening stand at 103. Rashid will now have Kohli to work with

dismissalText.commentary: Shikhar Dhawan c & b Rashid 67 (56b 10x4 0x6 80m) SR: 119.64

dismissalComment.html: chipped tamely back to the bowler! A tumbling take in Rashid's followthrough, just catching the leading edge as Dhawan's face closes on a clip to the leg side, failed to pick the googly perhaps... that's a massive double-strike for England!

headshotImage.caption: MM Ali headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: MM Ali headshot

dismissalText.commentary: Virat Kohli b Ali 7 (10b 1x4 0x6 14m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: a horrible hack from Kohli and he's bowled! Oh wow, that's turned a fair bit from an off-stump line, but Kohli's eyes were bigger than his stomach there, he rocked back for something wildly optimistic over the off-side, and had his leg stump clipped as the ball surged through... well, not so much a gate as a vacated citadel! England, from an invidious situation, are right back on it!

dismissalText.commentary: KL Rahul c Ali b Livingstone 7 (18b 0x4 0x6 27m) SR: 38.88

dismissalComment.html: a second-ball wicket for Livingstone! It's a terrible ball, but it's bagged a massive scalp! A hip-high full toss, drawing a one-handed thump across the line, and Moeen behind square pulls off a blinder, pouncing to his left to cling on in both hands!

dismissalText.commentary: Rishabh Pant c Buttler b Curran 78 (62b 5x4 4x6 79m) SR: 125.8

dismissalComment.html: edged and Buttler sticks out his left hand and pulls off a super-sharp one-handed catch. He makes it look ridiculously easy. Seam-up, pretty full and outside off, Pant camps back and aims to whip it away to the leg side. The ball hits the back of the bat and here comes Buttler's athletic intervention

dismissalText.commentary: Hardik Pandya b Stokes 64 (44b 5x4 4x6 63m) SR: 145.45

dismissalComment.html: Pandya shuffles across off, exposes his stumps, Stokes hits the leg stump. England have dismissed Pant and Hardik in a space of four overs. Pandya pre-meditates, probably aiming for a glance, but Stokes bests him in the end

dismissalText.commentary: Shardul Thakur c Buttler b Wood 30 (21b 1x4 3x6 35m) SR: 142.85

dismissalText.commentary: Bhuvneshwar Kumar c Curran b Topley 3 (5b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 60

dismissalComment.html: Topley hits that in-between length outside off. Bhuvneshwar clears his front leg and aims to slug it down the ground. He can only carve it in the air. Curran swoops in from mid-off and pouches it to wrap up India's innings

dismissalText.commentary: Jason Roy b Kumar 14 (6b 3x4 0x6 4m) SR: 233.33

dismissalComment.html: zings through the gate! Like I was intimating... in spite of the runs, Roy never quite looked at his imposing best in that extraordinary over, and he's undone with an utter pearler! Perfect length, perfect shape, nipping off the pitch, into the timbers through a flat-footed response!

dismissalText.commentary: Jonny Bairstow lbw b Kumar 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: way across his stumps and Bairstow is gone! He has reviewed, but that looked pretty adjacent to the naked eye. It may only be height that can save him. Leg stump is visible on the replay as his bat misses with a clip. Yep, thumping the top of leg, and both England's openers are gone!

dismissalText.commentary: Ben Stokes c Dhawan b Natarajan 35 (39b 4x4 1x6 53m) SR: 89.74

dismissalComment.html: full bunger on the pads, and Stokes has launched that straight to square leg! Huge moment ... is this above waist height? Stokes advanced to meet the ball, and that may undo him on the balance of probabilities. The ball was dipping, and yep, he has to go! That's a vast moment in this game. Advantage all India now

dismissalText.commentary: Jos Buttler lbw b Thakur 15 (18b 2x4 0x6 28m) SR: 83.33

dismissalComment.html: inducker from Thakur, slams the pad, not given out lbw. Kohli has a chat with Pant and asks for a review. Fullish and jagging back in to beat the inside edge and hit the front pad just above the knee-roll. Was this heading past leg stump? Nope, ball-tracking suggests that it would have struck leg stump. Golden arm: Shardul Thakur. Umpire Chaudhary has to reverse his on-field not-out decision

dismissalText.commentary: Adil Rashid c Kohli b Thakur 19 (22b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: stunner from Kohli in the covers! A chipped drive, low to the skipper's left, he was only going to get there with one hand, and he plunges superbly to grab, and out pop his eyes on stalks. A one-man meme machine in this contest! Thakur's cutters make the priceless breakthrough!

dismissalText.commentary: Dawid Malan c Sharma b Thakur 50 (50b 6x4 0x6 114m) SR: 100

dismissalText.commentary: Moeen Ali c HH Pandya b Kumar 29 (25b 2x4 2x6 36m) SR: 116

dismissalComment.html: lobbed to mid-off! A hard-handed drive from Moeen, but that thumps the toe of the bat, can't get the power through the stroke, and Hardik atones by leaping forward to scoop the low chance!

dismissalText.commentary: Adil Rashid c Kohli b Thakur 19 (22b 2x4 0x6 41m) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: stunner from Kohli in the covers! A chipped drive, low to the skipper's left, he was only going to get there with one hand, and he plunges superbly to grab, and out pop his eyes on stalks. A one-man meme machine in this contest! Thakur's cutters make the priceless breakthrough!

dismissalText.commentary: Mark Wood run out (HH Pandya/Pant) 14 (21b 1x4 0x6 60m) SR: 66.66

dismissalComment.html: decent yorker, decent connection, drilled to long-on, Wood gets his World Cup final skates on in an attempt to run back to the danger end, but it's a brilliant bullet throw from Pandya to the keeper, and he's short!
